thread.title: Swimming: John Jay fourth at league meet
thread.title_full: Swimming: John Jay fourth at league meet

author: J.B. Cozens
title: Swimming: John Jay fourth at league meet
text:
By J.B. Cozens on October 26, 2015 in High School Sports · 0 Comments 
The John Jay girls swim team had two more swimmers qualify for the Section 1 championships, at last Saturday’s Conference I League 2 meet at the Boys and Girls Club of Northern Westchester in Mt. Kisco. 
Emily Tuchman had a big day as she qualified for sectionals in both the 100- and 200-yard freestyle events, while Brianna Garofolo hit the qualifying mark in the 100-yard breaststroke. 
Kerry Kelly, Victoria Piacentino and Tuchman all finaled in two events at the meet, with Brianna Garofolo, Lily Buckley and Hailey Ivey finaling in one event each. 
The Indians had season-best times in 29 of their 35 swims. 
“We came prepared to swim on Saturday,” said Head Coach Meg Kaplan. “It was a big day for Emily Tuchman. I am very pleased with all that they were able to accomplish.” 
John Jay finished fourth at the meet with 265 points, behind Greeley (483), Fox Lane (434) and Croton Harmon-Hen Hud-Somers (302), but ahead of Yorktown (225), Brewster (143), Lakeland-Panas (120) and Putnam Valley (72). 
John Jay last week also defeated Port Chester in the final dual meet of the season, 48-41, to end the regular season with a 7-3 record. 
The section championships take place next Monday and Tuesday at Felix Festa Middle School in West Nyack. 
The team’s best finish on Saturday came in the 200-yard freestyle relay, where the team of Piacentino, Tuchman, Sarah McCormick and Kelly placed second with a time of 1:47.23 — a drop of more than four seconds off its previous season-best time. 
In the 400-yard freestyle relay, the team of Piacentino, Tuchman, Buckley and Kelly were third in 3:53.53, a season-best time by more than five seconds. 
Both relays moved up to 12th in the section standings with their efforts. 
The best finish individually was turned in by Kelly, who placed third in the 500-yard freestyle in a time of 5:16.6. She also took seventh in the 200-yard individual medley with a season-best time of 2:14.73. Kelly is already qualified for sectionals in the 500 freestyle, 200 IM, 100 butterfly and 100 freestyle, and for the state championships in the 500 free. 
Brianna Garofolo was fifth in the 100-yard breaststroke, with a season-best time of 1:13.85 that beat the section qualifying mark. She also placed ninth in the 200 IM with a time of 2:26.11 — a season best by more than four seconds. 
Tuchman lowered her season-best time in the 200-yard freestyle by nearly five seconds, with a section-qualifying time of 2:05.82, placing sixth. In the 100 freestyle, she finished seventh in 58.06, another season-best and section-qualifying time. 
Piacentino was seventh in the 100 butterfly with a second-best time (by more than two seconds) of 1:03.55, just .38 of second off the section-qualifying mark. She also placed eighth in the 100 freestyle with a time of 58.32. Piacentino was already qualified for sectionals in the 100 free. 
Ivey lowered season-best time in the 100 backstroke by more than two seconds with a 1:07.17, placing eighth. In the 200 IM, she dropped more than nine seconds off her season best with a time of 2:29.89, finishing 11th. 
Buckley was eighth in the 200 IM, lowering her season best by more than seven seconds with a 2:25.15. She also placed 11th in the 100 butterfly with a season-best time of 1:05.47. 
McCormick had season-best times in both of her events, taking 11th in the 50 freestyle (27.26) and 13th in the 100 freestyle (59.95). Her time in the 50 free was less than a second off the section-qualifying mark. 
Aubrey Chang also had a pair of season-best swims, taking 10th in the 500 free (5:56.9) and 12th in the 200 IM (2:13.71). 
Gianna Rappa was 11th in the 100 backstroke (season-best 1:10.34) and 13th in the 50 free (28.04), while Juliette Garofolo was 12th in the 100 breaststroke (1:17.67) and 14th in the 100 butterfly (1:10.41). 
In the 200-yard medley relay, the team of Hailey Ivey, Brianna Garofolo, Buckley and Rappa finished sixth with a season-best time of 2:03.66. 
Lucy Siegel was 18th in the 500 free with a time of 6:36.86, a drop of more than seven seconds off her season-best time. 
Alyssa Ramsay dropped her best time in the 100 breaststroke by about three and half seconds, finishing 19th in 1:26.67. IN the 100 butterfly, Arielle Gordon was 19th with a season-best 1:13.21. 
In the 200 freestyle, Isabella Driesen was 19th (2:26.45) and Julia Lynch was 23rd in 2:34.04, a season best by nearly four seconds. 
In the 50 free, Dana Marderstein was 24th (season-best 32.13) and Ashley Ramsay was 25th (32.16). 
Gabby Dowd placed 22nd in the 100 free, with a season-best time (by more than three seconds) of 1:09.28. 
Pam Buscema took nearly two seconds off her best time in the 100 breaststroke, finishing 22nd in 1:29.56. 
Kelly McKeon placed 25th in the 500 freestyle (7:21.55), while in the 100 backstroke, Caroline Heneghan was 20th (season-best 1:18.22) and Sophia Peris was 22nd (season-best 1:21.09). Related posts:
